qas.question: From which jhana did Buddha gain bodhi?
A logic problem arises when noting that the four truths constitute what?
The four truths depict what type of path of practice?

context: According to the Mahāsaccakasutta,[note 33] from the <a0_0>fourth<a0_0/> jhana the Buddha gained bodhi. Yet, it is not clear what he was awakened to.[page needed] "Liberating insight" is a later addition to this text, and reflects a later development and understanding in early Buddhism.[page needed][page needed] The mentioning of the four truths as constituting "<a1_0>liberating insight<a1_0/>" introduces a logical problem, since the four truths depict a <a2_0>linear<a2_0/> path of practice, the knowledge of which is in itself not depicted as being liberating.[note 34]
